TCGA Human Subjects Protection and Data Access Policies
row.field_page_description: A set of policies developed by NCI and NHGRI to protect the privacy of participants donating specimens to TCGA. Included are TCGA’s informed consent policy, data access policy and information about HIPAA Privacy Rule compliance.
row.field_list_description: A set of policies developed by NCI and NHGRI to protect the privacy of participants donating specimens to TCGA. Included are TCGA’s informed consent policy, data access policy and information about HIPAA Privacy Rule compliance.

row.title: TCGA Data Use Certification Agreement
row.field_page_description: A set of policies that researchers must agree to before gaining access to TCGA data. This agreement ensures that researchers who are pursuing a research question that requires controlled-access data will comply with TCGA policies, such as maintaining participants’ privacy, accessing the data securely, and following TCGA publication guidelines.
row.field_list_description: A set of policies that researchers must agree to before gaining access to TCGA data. This agreement ensures that researchers who are pursuing a research question that requires controlled-access data will comply with TCGA policies, such as maintaining participants’ privacy, accessing the data securely, and following TCGA publication guidelines.

row.title: Sharing Data from Large-scale Biological Research Projects
row.field_page_description: Principles for sharing and publishing genomic data in order to maximize public benefit developed at a meeting in Fort Lauderdale sponsored by the Wellcome Trust. These “Fort Lauderdale Principles” informed the original TCGA publication guidelines, which balance making genomic data immediately available for research use with protecting the initial publication rights of the original owner.
row.field_list_description: Principles for sharing and publishing genomic data in order to maximize public benefit developed at a meeting in Fort Lauderdale sponsored by the Wellcome Trust. These “Fort Lauderdale Principles” informed the original TCGA publication guidelines, which balance making genomic data immediately available for research use with protecting the initial publication rights of the original owner.

row.title: Considerations for Open Release of Genomic Data from Human Cancer Cell Lines

row.title: START Clauses Brochure
row.field_page_description: The START clauses represent a toolkit that provides standardized legal language for key elements of clinical trial agreements. This helps increase the efficiency of contract negotiations, resulting in reduced costs and accelerated entry of new therapies.
row.field_list_description: The START (Standard Terms of Agreement for Research Trial) clauses represent a toolkit that provides standardized legal language for key agreement elements common to most clinical trial agreements. By starting the negotiation process with commonly agreed upon language, the START clauses can simplify and accelerate the contracting process.

row.title: START Clauses Information
row.field_page_description: Negotiation of clinical trial agreements is viewed as one of the key barriers to timely initiation of clinical trials. The START clauses provide standardized legal language, designed to serve as a starting point for clinical trial contract negotiations.
row.field_list_description: Negotiation of clinical trial agreements between industry and academic medical centers is viewed as one of the key barriers to timely initiation of clinical trials. The START clauses provide standardized legal language, designed to serve as a starting point for clinical trial contract negotiations.

row.title: understanding-cervical-changes.epub

row.title: Understanding Cervical Changes: A Health Guide for Women
row.field_page_description: Explains abnormal Pap test, HPV test, and Pap/HPV cotest results. Treatment and follow-up care for abnormal cervical cancer screening results including ASC-US, AGC, LSIL, ASC-H, HSIL, AIS. Learn about colposcopy, types of biopsies, CIN, and HPV vaccine.
row.field_list_description: Explains what test results mean if a recent Pap test showed cell changes in the cervix; discusses that not all cervical changes mean cancer; explains the importance of getting follow-up care for abnormal results.
row.meta_keywords: abnormal Pap test, HPV test, cotest, cervical cancer screening results, ASC-US, AGC, LSIL, ASC-H, HSIL, AIS, colposcopy, cervical biopsies, CIN, HPV vaccine

row.title: Charting the Future of Cancer Health Disparities Research

row.field_page_description: Four leading cancer research organizations present a unified strategy to promote cooperation and ensure that cancer disparities research benefits all populations.

row.title: Cualquier persona puede padecer cáncer de piel
row.field_short_title: Cualquier persona puede padecer cáncer de piel
row.field_page_description: Este folleto explica que las personas de todos los tonos de piel pueden padecer cáncer de piel. Incluye imágenes de cáncer de piel en piel oscura y describe cómo detectarla temprano y reducir el riesgo de desarrollarla.

row.title: Cualquier persona puede padecer cáncer de piel —¡aprenda a proteger su piel!
row.field_short_title: Cualquier persona puede padecer cáncer de pie
row.field_page_description: Este artículo de Líneas vitales explica cómo cualquier persona tiene el riesgo de padecer cáncer de piel, incluso los afroamericanos y otros grupos de minorías de EE. UU. Además de proporcionar información básica sobre la prevención del cáncer de piel, el artículo destaca un folleto del Instituto Nacional del Cáncer (NCI) publicado recientemente sobre el tema.

row.title: Significado de los cambios en el cuello uterino: Guía para la salud de la mujer
row.field_short_title: Significado de los cambios en el cuello uterino: Guía para la salud de la mujer
row.field_page_description: Explica los pasos que deben seguirse después de un resultado anormal en una prueba de Pap o del VPH, así como las formas de diagnosticar y tratar las afecciones en el cuello uterino. También contiene información sobre las pautas para los exámenes de detección y las vacunas contra el VPH.
